intro: Stachys officinalis, commonly known as betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing spikes of violet to blue flowers. Betony is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its calming and healing effects.
